dataset.title: Snow water equivalent data for C1 Snotel, 1981 - ongoing.

address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research

abstract.para: The U.S. Soil Conservation Service (SCS) operates hundreds of Snotel sites throughout the western United States. One of these is on Niwot Ridge at C-1, located approximately 1.6 km, by road, from the University of Colorado Mountain Research Station at an approximate elevation of 3000 meters. The Snotel installations operate on the principle that the snowpack exerts pressure on liquid-filled stainless steel "pillows" that rest on the ground. Pressure transducers output a digital signal that is sent via radio telemetry to one of two receiving stations. The transducer output is calibrated by measuring snowpack depth and density on or about the 25th of each month from December through April. A Mt. Rose snow sampler was used to determine the depth and density of the snowpack at each of the "pillow's" four corners. These four values were averaged to determine the monthly snow water equivalent (SWE) in inches.

section.title: Niwot LTER Data Policy
section.para:
The following acknowledgment should accompany any publication or citation of these data:
Logistical support and/or data were provided by the NSF-supported Niwot Ridge (NWT) Long-Term Ecological Research (LTER) project and the University of Colorado (CU) Mountain Research Station (MRS).
The user of NWT LTER data agrees to provide proper acknowledgment with each usage of the data. Citation of the name(s) of the investigator(s) responsible for the data set, in addition to the generic statement above, constitutes proper acknowledgment. Author(s) (including NWT investigators) of published material that makes use of previously unpublished NWT data agree to provide the NWT data manager with a PDF of that material as soon as it becomes available. The user of NWT data agrees not to resell or redistribute shared data.

section.title: Disclaimer
section.para: The NSF-supported NWT LTER project shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein, nor assumes liability for misuse, manipulation or distribution of the data. These data are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The user of these data should be aware that, while efforts have been taken to ensure that these data are of the highest quality, there is no guarantee of perfection for the data contained herein and the possibility of errors exists. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and in a manner consistent with the limitations of data in general and these data in particular. Users assume responsibility to determine the usability of the dataset. NWT LTER gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data be directly acquired from the NWT LTER server and not indirectly through other sources that may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on computer systems at CU, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on other systems for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Study site was C-1 (also known as Como and located on the southeastern flank of Niwot Ridge). Original data are stored at Research Laboratory #1 and the Mountain Research Station.

description.para: The initial iteration of the documentation section of this file was generated by Mark Losleben and Rick Ingersoll in mid-January 1995. The data through 26 December 1994 were appended to the data section and the file was put under sccs control on 27 February 1995.[RCI 27 February 1995] Data for January and February 1995 were appended to the data section on 6 March 1995.[RCI 6 March 1995] A comment regarding different units for raw measurements vs. calculated means on 15 March 1995.[RCI 15 March 1995] Data for March 1995 were appended to the data section on 14 April 1995.[RCI 14 April 1995] Data for April 1995 were appended to the data section on 9 May 1995.[RCI 9 May 1995] Data for 22 May 1995 were appended to the data section on 30 May 1995. [RCI 30 May 1995] Data for 30 May 1995 were appended to the data section on 6 June 1995.[RCI 6 June 1995] Data for 13 June 1995 were appended to the data section on 16 June 1995.[RCI 16 June 1995] The location section, which heretofore had been absent, was added on 9 February 1996. Data for 26 December 1995 and 25 January 1996 were appended to the data section on 9 February 1996.[MAH 9 February 1996] Data for 26 February 1996 were appended to the data section on 6 March 1996.[MAH 6 March 1996] Data for 29 March 1996 were appended to the data section on 9 April 1996.[MAH 9 April 1996] Data for 29 April 1996 and 15 May 1996 were appended to the data section on 29 May 1996.[MAH 29 May 1996] Data for 31 December 1996, 30 January 1997, 28 February 1997, and 31 March 1997 were appended to the data section on 7 May 1997.[MAH 7 May 1997] Data for 30 April and 25 May 1997 were appended to the data section on 9 June 1997.[MAH 9 June 1997] Comments regarding a new scale as well as observations made on 30 May 1997 and 2 June 1997 were added to the comments section on 26 June 1997.[MAH 26 June 1997] Data for 30 November 1997 and 25 December 1997 were appended to the data section on 14 January 1998.[MAH 14 January 1998] Data for 28 January 1998 were appended to the data section on 16 February 1998.[MAH 16 February 1998] Data for 27 February 1998 were appended to the data section on 24 March 1998.[MAH 24 March 1998] Data for 30 March 1998 were appended to the data section on 9 April 1998.[MAH 9 April 1998] Data for 16 April were appended to the data section on 7 May 1998.[MAH 7 May 1998] Data for 29 April 1998 and 15 May 1998 were appended to the data section on 12 June 1998.[MAH 12 June 1998] Data for 31 December 1998 and 29 January 1999 were appended to the data section on 26 February 1999. Comments for 2 June 1998 and 1 December 1998 were appended to the comments section on that date as well.[MAH 26 February 1999] Data for 17 February 1999 were appended to the data section on 25 March 1999.[MAH 25 March 1999] Data for 15 May 1999, 31 December 1999, 31 January 2000, 29 February 2000, 31 March 2000, and 1 May 2000 were appended to the data section on 16 August 2000.[MAH 16 August 2000] Data for 31 March 1999 were inserted into the data section on 21 September 2000.[MAH 21 Septeber 2000] Data for 30 April 1999 inserted into data section on 1 Feb 2001.[TMA 1 February 2001] Data for 31 Jan 2001 appended to the data section on 5 Feb 2001.[TMA 5 February 2001] Data for February, March, and April 2001 were appended to the data section on 30 July 2001.[TMA 30 July 2001] Data for 1 January 2002 were appended to the data section on 12 February 2002.[TMA 12 February 2002] Data for 31 January 2002 and 1 March 2002 were appended to the data section on 25 March 2002.[TMA 25 March 2002] Data for 29 March and 30 April 2002 were appended to the data section on 25 September 2002.[TMA 25 September 2002] Data for 31 December 2002 to 27 February 2003 were appended to the data section.[TMA 25 March 2003] Data for 30 March through 29 December 2003 were appended to the data section.[TMA 6 February 2004] Data for January 2004 through May 2004 were appended to the data section.[TMA 19 January 2005] Data for December 2004 through March 2005 were appended to the data section.[TMA 20 May 2005] Data for April 2005 through March 2006 were appended to the data section.[TMA 20 March 2007] Data for November 2006 through March 2007 were appended to the data section.[TMA 22 May 2007] Appended April, May, December 2007 data to the data section.[TMA 05 June 2008] Appended 2008 - 2010 data; title, variables, keywords, comments, cols, and data format edited.[HCH 06 July 2013]
begin 2 November 1981, ongoing, approximately monthly during winter.

section.para: These data were manually entered using an EasyEntry form and then processed on niwotlter, the NWT LTER workstation. Additional snow water equivalent data for Niwot Ridge can be found in http://niwot.colorado.edu/exec/.extracttoolA?snowateq.mw A new scale was used beginning with the 31 December 1997 measurement. On 30 May 1997, field personnel made the following notation: There is still snow at C1. The northern two corners are melted out, the snow depth at the southeast corner is 55 cm, and the Snotel homepage (http://wrcc.sage.dri.edu/index.html) reports 6.1 inches of telemetered snow water equivalence at this site today (200%). On 2 June 1997, field personnel made the following notation: The nothern half of the Snotel pillow rectangle was snow-free, and the NE corner depth was 30 cm (deepest corner depth). The Snotel telemetered snow water equivalent, via their homepage (http://wrcc.sage.dri.edu/index.html), was 1.5 inches (94%). Field personnel reported that the Snotel site was 100% snowfree on 2 June 1998. Field personnel reported that 1 December 1998 there was 20 cm snow depth measured at the Snotel site, and the Snotel web page showed 1.1" SWE, for 37% average. Note: Snow depths and water contents were recorded in inches. The calculated means for those 2 variables are in centimeters.

dataTable.entityDescription: Snow water equivalent data for C1 Snotel, 1981 - ongoing.
